awareness.title: Public Awareness & Safety Guide
awareness.hero_desc: Understanding disaster protocols saves lives. Select a category below to view detailed safety guidelines.
awareness.source: These guidelines are sourced from National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) protocols.

cyclone.title: Cyclones
cyclone.desc: Stay indoors, keep emergency kit ready, and listen to radio updates.

content.immediate: Stay indoors and away from windows. Listen to official radio/TV broadcasts.
before: Inspect your house and secure loose tiles, windows, and doors.
Trim trees branches that could fall on your house.
Keep an emergency kit ready with food, water, and medicines.
Identify safe shelters in your area.
during: Switch off electrical mains and gas supply.
Keep doors and windows shut.
Drink boiled or chlorinated water.
Do not venture out until officially advised.
after: Do not touch loose or dangling power wires.
Check for gas leaks before using the stove.
Clear debris from your premises carefully.
dos: Keep essential documents in waterproof bags
donts: Do not go near the sea

earthquake.title: Earthquakes
earthquake.desc: Drop, Cover, and Hold On. Stay away from windows and heavy furniture.

content.immediate: DROP to the ground; take COVER by getting under a sturdy table or other piece of furniture; and HOLD ON until the shaking stops.
before: Secure heavy furniture like cupboards and bookshelves to the wall.
Identify safe spots in each room (under sturdy tables).
Practice 'Drop, Cover, and Hold On' drills with family.
during: If indoors, stay there. Get under a desk or table.
Stay away from glass, windows, outside doors and walls.
If outdoors, move away from buildings, streetlights, and utility wires.
If in a moving vehicle, stop as quickly as safety permits and stay in the vehicle.
after: Check yourself and others for injuries.
If you are trapped, do not light a match. Cover your mouth with a cloth.
donts: Do not rush to the exit

lightning.title: Lightning
lightning.desc: Avoid open fields, tall trees, and water bodies. Unplug electronics.

content.immediate: Seek shelter in a substantial building or fully enclosed metal-topped vehicle.
before: Check weather forecasts before outdoor activities.
Install surge protectors for expensive electronics.
during: Avoid open fields, the top of a hill or a ridge top.
Stay away from tall, isolated trees or other tall objects.
If you are in a forest, stay near a lower stand of trees.
If you are in a group, spread out to avoid the current traveling between group members.
after: Wait at least 30 minutes after the last thunder before leaving shelter.
donts: Do not lie flat on the ground

flood.title: Floods
flood.desc: Move to higher ground. Do not walk or drive through flood waters.

content.immediate: Move to higher ground immediately. Do not attempt to walk, swim, or drive through floodwaters.
before: Know the flood risk in your area.
Keep sandbags ready if you live in a low-lying area.
Elevate furnace, water heater, and electric panel if susceptible to flooding.
during: Listen to the radio or television for information.
Turn off utilities at usage if told to do so.
Do not walk through moving water. Six inches is enough to knock you down.
Do not drive into flooded areas.
after: Avoid floodwaters; water may be contaminated by oil, gasoline, or raw sewage.
Be aware of areas where floodwaters have receded.
Clean and disinfect everything that got wet.
dos: Keep a stick to check water depth
donts: Do not touch electrical equipment if wet
Do not eat food exposed to flood water

fire.title: Fire Safety
fire.desc: Crawl low under smoke. Stop, Drop, and Roll if clothes catch fire.

content.immediate: Get out, stay out, and call for help. Do not go back inside for anything.
before: Install smoke alarms on every level of your home.
Plan two ways out of every room.
Keep a fire extinguisher in the kitchen.
during: Crawl low under smoke to your exit.
Check doors for heat before opening.
If your clothes catch fire: Stop, Drop, and Roll.
after: Call the fire department if you haven't already.
Treat burns immediately with cool water.
Do not re-enter the building until authorities say it is safe.
donts: Do not hide in closets or under beds
Do not go back for pets or valuables

landslide.title: Landslides
landslide.desc: Stay alert during heavy rain. Move away from the path of the slide.

content.immediate: Move away from the path of the landslide or debris flow as quickly as possible.
before: Avoid building near steep slopes, close to mountain edges, or near natural erosion valleys.
Get a ground assessment of your property.
during: Stay awake and alert during severe storms.
Listen for unusual sounds containing trees cracking or boulders knocking together.
Move to the second story if possible if you are near a stream or channel.
after: Stay away from the slide area. There may be danger of additional slides.
Check for injured and trapped persons near the slide, without entering the direct slide area.
Look for and report broken utility lines.
dos: Curl into a ball if trapped
donts: Do not drive relative to the slide path
Do not return home until safe
